intro: Aganisia ionoptera, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. It produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals, containing various alkaloids.
